{{Infobox NCAA Basketball Conference Tournament | Year = 2010 | Conference = Pacific-10 Conference | Division = I | Gender = Men's | Image = Pac10BasketballTournamentPacificLife.png | ImageSize = 160px | Caption = 2010 tournament logo | Teams = 9 | Arena = [[Staples Center]] | City = [[Los Angeles, California]] | Champions = [[Washington Huskies men's basketball|Washington]] | TitleCount = 2nd | Coach = [[Lorenzo Romar]] | CoachCount = 2nd | MVP = [[Isaiah Thomas (basketball)|Isaiah Thomas]], | MVPTeam = [[Washington Huskies|Washington]] | Attendance = 15,851 | OneTopScorer = | TwoTopScorers = | TopScorer = | TopScorerTeam = | TopScorer2 = | TopScorer2Team = | Points = | Television = [[Fox Sports Net|FSN]], [[CBS Sports|CBS]] }} {{2009â10 Pacific-10 Conference men's basketball standings}} The '''2010 [[Pacific Life]] [[Pacific-10 Conference]] [[Pacific-10 Conference Men's Basketball Tournament|Men's Basketball Tournament]]''' was played with the first round on March 10, 2010 at the [[Staples Center]] in [[Los Angeles]], California, with quarterfinals on March 11, semifinals on March 12, and the finals on March 13 (3:00 p.m. PT)[http://www.pac-10.org/sports/m-baskbl/spec-rel/2009-mbb-tournament.html Pac-10 Tournament official site]. [[2009â10 Washington Huskies men's basketball team|Washington]], the tournament champion, became the [[2010 NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Tournament|NCAA Tournament]] automatic qualifier from the conference. ==Seeds== All Pacific 10 schools except USC played in the tournament.[http://sports.espn.go.com/los-angeles/ncb/news/story?id=4792634 ESPN USC punishes itself for rules violations], ''ESPN.com'', January 3, 2010 USC was banned from post season play as a result of self-imposed sanctions for illegal benefits received during the 2007â2008 season. Teams were seeded by conference record, with a tiebreaker system used to seed teams with identical conference records. {| class="wikitable" |- bgcolor="#efefef" !Seed !School !Record:
Conference (Overall) |- |1 |California |13â5 (21â9) |- |2 |Arizona State |12â6 (22â9) |- |3 |Washington |11â7 (21â9) |- |4 |Arizona |10â8 (16â14) |- |5 |UCLA |8â10 (13â17) |- |6 |Oregon State |8â10 (14â16) |- |7 |Stanford |7â11 (13â17) |- |8 |Oregon |7â11 (15â15) |- |9 |Washington State |6â12 (16â14) |- |} ==2010 Pac-10 Tournament== ===Schedule=== * Wed., Mar. 10: Oregon vs. Washington State, 8 p.m. FSN; * Thur., Mar. 11: Arizona vs. UCLA, 12 noon FSN; Oregon vs. California, 2:30 p.m. FSN; Stanford vs. Arizona State, 6 p.m. FSN; Washington vs. Oregon State, 8:30 p.m. FSN * Fri., Mar. 12: Semifinal 1, 6 p.m. FSN; Semifinal 2, 8:30 p.m. FSN * Sat., Mar. 13 Championship Game, 3:15 p.m. CBS (Pacific time) {{4RoundBracket-Byes | RD1=First Round

team|California]] | RD4-score01=75 | RD4-seed02 =3 | RD4-team02 ='''[[University of Washington|Washington]]''' | RD4-score02='''79''' }} ==Tournament notes== *Officials: Dick Cartmell, Scott Thornley, Michael Reed *Attendance: 15,851 *[[Jerome Randle]] became Cal's leading scorer during the tournament when Cal defeated UCLA 85â72 in the semifinals, surpassing [[Sean Lampley]] with 1,790 career points{{cite web|title=California beats UCLA 85â72 in Pac-10 semifinals|date=2010-03-13|accessdate=2010-03-15|publisher=[[Pac-10]].org|url=http://rivals.yahoo.com/ncaa/basketball/recap?gid=201003120095}} and was perfect at the free-throw line (16â16), a new record. The old mark was made by [[Sean Elliott]] of Arizona, who was 96.3% (26â27) in 1989. * Golden Bears shot 87.0% free throws (20â23) at the championship game and set the Pac-10 tournament team record of 85.2% (52â61) for the three games, breaking Arizona's 1989 mark of 82.6% (57â69). * Second time meeting between Cal and Washington in the Pac-10 tournament, Cal won in 2008 84â81. * Cal and Washington both were invited to participate in the [[2010 NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Tournament]], with Washington receiving the automatic bid, and Cal getting an at-large bid. * Arizona State was invited to participate in the [[2010 National Invitation Tournament]] * Oregon State was invited to participate in the [[2010 College Basketball Invitational]] ==All-Tournament Team== * Jamal Boykin, F, California * Quincy Pondexter, F, Washington * Jerome Randle, G, California * Theo Robertson, F, California * Michael Roll, G, UCLA ==Most Outstanding Player== * Isaiah Thomas, G, Washington ==2010 Hall of Honor inductees== Pac-10 menâs basketball Pac-10 Hall of Honor luncheon was held on Saturday, March 13, 2010 to honor an individual from each of the Pac-10 member schools.[http://www.pac-10.org/sports/m-baskbl/spec-rel/020510aah.html Pac-10 Basketball Hall of Honor to Induct 2009â10 Class], ''Pac-10.org'' *[[Mike Bibby]] (Arizona) *Jeremy Veal (Arizona State)
